official_title: To amend the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to authorize the President to allocate crude oil and petroleum products, and to limit prices thereof, in the event of a severe petroleum supply shortage.

summary.text: Standby Petroleum Allocation Act of 1990 - Amends the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to direct the President to promulgate and transmit to the Congress a standby regulation for the mandatory 90-day allocation of petroleum products which includes an optional standby crude oil sharing program designed to result in a significant reduction of adverse effects on consumers served by refiners whose crude oil supplies are disproportionately reduced during a severe petroleum supply shortage. Allows petroleum price limitations, disallowing minimum prices. Provides for implementation of the regulation on a national or regional basis.
